data.title: String Game
data.statement:
You are given [[n]] strings and you want to determine which one is more expensive (has bigger price)

Price of a string = sum of prices pf all string characters

Price of a character c = ascii of character c * position of character c in the string

Note : the position of characters in the string starts from 1

If there is more than one string with maximum price, output the biggest lexicographically one of them

testCases.title: Equal Prices 2
testCases.testIn:
6
admin4
admit0
cdapt1
cdapt7
pass45
pasz21

write Most Expensive And Biggest lexicographically String
data.inputDescription:
<< line 1  :  >> A single number [[n]]
<< then {{n}} lines follow  :  >> Each line has a single string {{s}}
It is guaranteed that all strings don't contain spaces
data.outputDescription: <<  line 1  :  >> String {{p}}, where {{p}} is the most expensive and biggest lexicographically  string s

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You are given n strings and you want to determine which one is more expensive (has bigger price)

Price of a string = sum of prices pf all string characters

Price of a character c = ascii of character c * position of character c in the string

Note : the position of characters in the string starts from 1

If there is more than one string with maximum price, output the biggest lexicographically one of them
Input
line 1 : A single number n
then n lines follow : Each line has a single string s
It is guaranteed that all strings don't contain spaces
Output
line 1 : String p, where p is the most expensive and biggest lexicographically string s
Constraints
1 ≤ n ≤ 100
1 ≤ Size of string s ≤ 100
Example
Input
2
AA
aaa
Output
aaa
